title: The Call - Discography (7)
description:
The Call - A San Francisco Bay Area-based rock band originally formed in Santa Cruz in 1980 by vocalist/guitarist Michael Been, Scott Musick, and Tom Ferrier. Been and Musick were originally from Oklahoma.
Critically acclaimed (by their peers, such as Bono and Peter Gabriel, and critics) the band only ever reached cult status publicly. Mostly known for The Walls Came Down from &#039;82&#039; and Let the Day Begin (&#039;89&#039;.)

Albums details
Best of The Mercury years excludes only a few tracks from the groups first three albums (The Call, Modern Romans and Scene Beyond Dreams... which were only released on vinyl.) The Best of the Call (&#039;97) is not included here but there is only two or three previously unreleased &#039;The Call&#039; tracks on that album anyway. Apart from this all commercially released tracks by The Call are here.

Technical
MP3Gain (http://mp3gain.sourceforge.net/) was used to tag (non-destructive) songs with APEv2 - players use this tag to play all songs at same perceived volume (no, this is not the same as normalizing, but superior). In this case the volume used was 90.6db (optimum volume before clipping). If you change any ID data you will likely find a difference in volume between songs. You will not need an audio editor to fix this, just switchoff/delete the APEv2 tag on all tracks or retag with mp3gain. 
Recommended player Winamp5.5x. to access and/or remove all these tags if it is your desire.
